Package com.atakmap.android.attachment.layer

Class GLAttachmentBillboardLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.attachment.layer.GLAttachmentBillboardLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MapEventDispatcher.MapEventDispatchListener, MapItem.OnGroupChangedListener, MapItem.OnHeightChangedListener, MapItem.OnVisibleChangedListener, PointMapItem.OnPointChangedListener, AttachmentWatcher.Listener, Layer.OnLayerVisibleChangedListener, GLLayer, GLLayer2, GLLayer3, GLMapRenderable, GLMapRenderable2, Releasable
    public class GLAttachmentBillboardLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements GLLayer3, MapEventDispatcher.MapEventDispatchListener, MapItem.OnGroupChangedListener, MapItem.OnVisibleChangedListener, MapItem.OnHeightChangedListener, PointMapItem.OnPointChangedListener, Layer.OnLayerVisibleChangedListener, AttachmentWatcher.Listener
    Draws attachment thumbnails as "billboards" above map items

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: GLLayer2
        Transitions the layer renderer into the Started state. The renderer may only access its subject while in the Started state.

        This method may be invoked from any thread, however, it may never be called concurrently with GLLayer2.stop().

        Specified by:
        start in interface GLLayer2

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Description copied from interface: GLLayer2
        Transitions the layer renderer into the Stopped state. The renderer may not access its subject until returning to the Started state, however, any renderable content previously derived may continue to be rendered.

        This method may be invoked from any thread, however, it may never be called concurrently with GLLayer2.start().

        Specified by:
        stop in interface GLLayer2

      • getSubject

        public Layer getSubject()
        Specified by:
        getSubject in interface GLLayer

      • draw

        public void draw​(GLMapView view)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable
        Parameters:
        view - The current view

      • draw

        public void draw​(GLMapView view,
                 int renderPass)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable2.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Parameters:
        view - The current view
        renderPass - The render pass being executed during this invocation. The value will be the bitwise-OR of any of the flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Only content valid for the specified pass should be rendered.

      • getRenderPass

        public int getRenderPass()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Returns a flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for. The returned value should be the bitwise-OR of any of the following flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Specified by:
        getRenderPass in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Returns:
        A flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for

      • release

        public void release()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable
        Releases any resources allocated by the renderable as a result of the invocation of the GLMapRenderable.draw(GLMapView) method. This method will be invoked when a renderable that was previously being rendered is no longer eligible for rendering (e.g. a tile that is no longer in view on the map). The renderable may be reinitialized and rendered via a subsequent call to GLMapRenderable.draw(GLMapView) in the future.

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        release in interface GLMapRenderable
        Specified by:
        release in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Specified by:
        release in interface Releasable
